intro: Brassaia mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Brassaia mannii thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
